body:
Thanks for the report. Can you confirm that the following (somewhat simpler) patch also accomplishes the same, and if yes, would you mind sending a PR? ðŸ˜ƒ  Thanks!

```diff
diff --git a/mitmproxy/proxy/layers/http/__init__.py b/mitmproxy/proxy/layers/http/__init__.py
index 0b134f7bb..85dd85264 100644
--- a/mitmproxy/proxy/layers/http/__init__.py
+++ b/mitmproxy/proxy/layers/http/__init__.py
@@ -244,7 +244,9 @@ class HttpStream(layer.Layer):
         elif isinstance(event, RequestEndOfMessage):
             if callable(self.flow.request.stream):
                 chunks = self.flow.request.stream(b"")
-                if isinstance(chunks, bytes):
+                if chunks == b"":
+                    chunks = []
+                elif isinstance(chunks, bytes):
                     chunks = [chunks]
                 for chunk in chunks:
                     yield SendHttp(RequestData(self.stream_id, chunk), self.context.server)
@@ -324,7 +326,9 @@ class HttpStream(layer.Layer):
         if isinstance(event, ResponseData):
             if callable(self.flow.response.stream):
                 chunks = self.flow.response.stream(event.data)
-                if isinstance(chunks, bytes):
+                if chunks == b"":
+                    chunks = []
+                elif isinstance(chunks, bytes):
                     chunks = [chunks]
             else:
                 chunks = [event.data]
```

I will try but I am pretty sure that it will work for me as my addon just returns what it gets. But if you allow an addon that _modifies_ data to return an `Iterable` for multiple chunks of data then I think the `if chunks == b"":` will raise an exception.
Comparing an interable / a list to `b""` will just return false, but not raise an exception. :-)

Learned something, thanks! :) With that in mind your solution is best. The path for the response code is for the normal data chunk processing, not for the final empty byte string. It's a change of contract but it would make sense to have all four usages of the callable prevent sending any data if they return `b""`. That way a code that modifies data can just make a chunk completely vanish. To make things just work only the end-of-stream calls need it. Let me know what you prefer before I make the PR.

> That way a code that modifies data can just make a chunk completely vanish.

You can always do that by passing an empty iterable. Let's keep the non-final data frame processing as-is, that way empty data frames sent by one side are retained.

issue.title: Fix #5077

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body: As requested, the tested and working fix for issue #5077.

body: Fine with me. :) PR is sent. Thanks for taking care of this. Now I can send a PR for my addon.

issue.title: don't send empty data frame without end-of-stream flag

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
Due to CVE-2019-9518[1], HTTP/2 server and client may reject empty data frame without end-of-stream
flag with GOAWAY frame and FRAME_SIZE_ERROR.
    
This patch completes the fix at [2] for events RequestData and ResponseData too.
    
[1]. https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-9518
[2]. https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/issues/5077
